bwwExcerpt: Everything unfolds with predictably smooth Times Square professionalism, and I can imagine the results appealing to fans of "Jersey Boys" (including the dances, which were choreographed by Sergio Trujillo, who worked on that show as well). But for all its slickness, "A Bronx Tale" is nothing more than a weightless comic-book adaptation of the movie on which it's based, stripped of the understated yet ever-present sense of threat that gave the film so much of its dramatic force. Here, by contrast

keyPhrases.quote: But for all its slickness, 'A Bronx Tale' is nothing more than a weightless comic-book adaptation.
